briefing_note: Discovery mode — 10 strengths from docs/research, 9 hypothesized gaps in playbook. Collecting empirical evidence.

strengths.summary: Filters on clustered columns skip micro-partitions at scan level
strengths.field_note: Snowflake's #1 optimization. Functions on filter columns kill pruning.

strengths.summary: Reads only columns referenced by final query, even through CTEs
strengths.field_note: Automatic unless final SELECT is *. May fail through joins (H5).

strengths.summary: Filters pushed to storage layer including through single-ref CTEs
strengths.field_note: Also does predicate mirroring across join sides.

strengths.summary: Correlated subqueries automatically decorrelated to hash joins
strengths.field_note: Benchmarked on TPCH_SF100: equal or better than manual decorrelation.
Never materialize EXISTS patterns. Kills early termination.

strengths.summary: Bloom filter pushdown from build side to probe-side TableScan
strengths.field_note: 77/99 TPC-DS queries. Restructuring joins may lose this.

strengths.summary: Evaluates multiple join orders, selects lowest cost
strengths.field_note: Usually correct. Fails with functions on join keys (H2).

strengths.summary: MIN/MAX/COUNT served from micro-partition metadata without scan
Native window-function filtering, more efficient than nested subquery
strengths.field_note: Gives optimizer full visibility into filter intent.

strengths.summary: Multi-level partial aggregation for parallel warehouse execution
strengths.field_note: Nested Aggregate nodes in all agg queries.
